Agendas.Anti-Intellectual Revolution.Des.value: FOR : After a player researches a technology, they must destroy 1 of their non-fighter ships.
AGAINST : At the start of the next strategy phase, each player chooses and exhausts 1 planet for each technology they own.

Agendas.Armed Forces Standardization.Des.value: The elected player places command tokens from their reinforcements so that they have 3 tokens in their tactic pool, 3 tokens in their fleet pool and 2 tokens in their strategy pool. They return any excess tokens to their reinforcements.

Agendas.Arms Reduction.Description.value: FOR : Each player destroys all but 2 of their dreadnaughts and all but 4 of their cruisers.
AGAINST : At the start of the next strategy phase, each player exhausts each of their planets that have a technology specialty.

Agendas.Articles of War.Description.value: FOR : All mechs lose their printed abilities except for SUSTAIN DAMAGE.
AGAINST : Each player that voted "For" gains 3 trade goods.

Agendas.Checks and Balances.Description.value: FOR : When a player chooses a strategy card during the strategy phase, they give that strategy card to another player that does not have 1 (or a player that does not have 2 in a three- or four-player game), if able.
AGAINST : Each player readies only 3 of their planets at the end of this agenda phase.

Agendas.Clandestine Operations.Descripti.value: FOR : Each player removes 2 command tokens from their command sheet and returns those tokens to their reinforcements.
AGAINST : Each player removes 1 command token from their fleet pool and returns that token to their reinforcements.

Agendas.Classified Document Leaks.Descri.value: When this agenda is revealed, if there are no scored secret objectives, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
The elected secret objective becomes a public objective; place it near the other public objectives in the common play area.

Agendas.Colonial Redistribution.Descript.value: Destroy each unit on the elected planet.
Then, the player who controls that planet chooses 1 player with the fewest victory points; that player may place 1 infantry from their reinforcements on the elected planet.

Agendas.Committee Formation.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
Before players vote on an agenda that requires a player to be elected, the owner of this card may discard this card to choose a player to be elected. Players do not vote on that agenda.

Agendas.Compensated Disarmament.Descript.value: Destroy each ground force on the elected planet; for each unit that was destroyed, the player who controls that planet gains 1 trade good.

Agendas.Conventions of War.Description.value: FOR : Players cannot use BOMBARDMENT against units that are on cultural planets.
AGAINST : Each player that voted "Against" discards all of their action cards.

Agendas.Core Mining.Description.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
Then, destroy 1 infantry on the planet.
The resource value of this planet is increased by 2.

Agendas.Covert Legislation.Description.value: When this agenda is revealed, the speaker draws the next card in the agenda deck but does not reveal it to the other players.

Instead, the speaker reads the eligible outcomes aloud (For, Against, Elect Player, etc.); the other players vote for these outcomes as if they were outcomes of this agenda, without knowing their effects.

Agendas.Demilitarized Zone.Description.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
Then, destroy all units on that planet.
Player's units cannot land, be produced, or be placed on this planet.

Agendas.Economic Equality.Description.value: FOR : Each player returns all of their trade goods to the supply. Then, each player gains 5 trade goods.
AGAINST : Each player returns all of their trade goods to the supply.

Agendas.Enforced Travel Ban.Description.value: FOR : Alpha and beta wormholes have no effect during movement.
AGAINST : Destroy each PDS in or adjacent to a system that contains a wormhole.

Agendas.Executive Sanctions.Description.value: FOR : Each player can have a maximum of 3 action cards in their hand.
AGAINST : Each player discards 1 random action card from their hand.

Agendas.Fleet Regulations.Description.value: FOR : Each player cannot have more than 4 tokens in their fleet pool.
AGAINST : Each player places 1 command token from their reinforcements in their fleet pool.

Agendas.Galactic Crisis Pact.Description.value: Each player may perform the secondary ability of the elected strategy card without spending a command token; command tokens placed by the ability are placed from a player's reinforcements instead.

Agendas.Holy Planet of Ixth.Description.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
The planet's owner gains 1 victory point.
Units on this planet cannot use PRODUCTION.
When a player gains control of this planet, they gain 1 victory point.
When a player loses control of this planet, they lose 1 victory point.

Agendas.Homeland Defense Act.Description.value: FOR : Each player can have any number of PDS units on planets they control.
AGAINST : Each player destroys 1 of their PDS units.

Agendas.Imperial Arbiter.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
At the end of the strategy phase, the owner of this card may discard this card to swap 1 of their strategy cards with 1 of another player's strategy cards.

Agendas.Incentive Program.Description.value: FOR : Draw and reveal 1 stage I public objective from the deck and place it near the public objectives.
AGAINST : Draw and reveal 1 stage II public objective from the deck and place it near the public objectives.

Agendas.Ixthian Artifact.Description.value: FOR : The speaker rolls 1 die. If the result is 6-10, each player may research 2 technologies. If the result is 1-5, destroy all units in Mecatol Rex's system, and each player with units in systems adjacent to Mecatol Rex's system destroys 3 of their units in each of those systems.

Agendas.Judicial Abolishment.Description.value: When this agenda is revealed, if there are no laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
Discard the elected law from play.

Agendas.Minister of Commerce.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
After the owner of this card replenishes commodities, they gain 1 trade good for each player that is their neighbor.

Agendas.Minister of Exploration.Descript.value: The elected player gains this card.
When the owner of this card gains control of a planet, they gain 1 trade good.

Agendas.Minister of Industry.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
When the owner of this card places a space dock in a system, their units in that system may use their PRODUCTION abilities.

Agendas.Minister of Peace.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
After a player activates a system that contains 1 or more of a different player's units, the owner of this card may discard this card; immediately end the active player's turn.

Agendas.Minister of Policy.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
At the end of the status phase, the owner of this card draws 1 action card.

Agendas.Minister of Sciences.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
When the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Technology" strategy card, they do not need to spend resources to research technology.

Agendas.Minister of War.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.

The owner of this card may discard this card after performing an action to remove 1 of their command counters from the game board and return it to their reinforcements; then they may perform 1 additional action.

Agendas.Miscount Disclosed.Description.value: When this agenda is revealed, if there are no laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
Vote on the elected law as if it were just revealed from the top of the deck.

Agendas.Mutiny.Description.value: FOR : Each player who voted "For" gains 1 victory point.
AGAINST : Each player who voted "For" loses 1 victory point.

Agendas.New Constitution.Description.value: When this agenda is revealed, if there are no laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
FOR : Discard all laws in play. At the start of the next strategy phase, each player exhausts each planet in their home system.

Agendas.Nexus Sovereignty.Description.value: FOR : Alpha and beta wormholes in the wormhole nexus have no effect during movement.
AGAINST : Place a gamma wormhole token in the Mecatol Rex system.

Agendas.Political Censure.Description.value: The elected player gains this card and 1 victory point.
The elected player cannot play action cards.
If the owner of this card loses this card, they lose 1 victory point.

Agendas.Prophecy of Ixth.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
The owner of this card applies +1 to the result of their fighter's combat rolls. When the owner of this card uses PRODUCTION, they discard this card unless they produce 2 or more fighters.

Agendas.Public Execution.Description.value: The elected player discards all of their action cards. If they have the speaker token, they give it to the player on their left. The elected player cannot vote on any agendas during this agenda phase.

Agendas.Publicize Weapon Schematics.Desc.value: FOR : If any player owns a war sun technology, all players may ignore all prerequisites on war sun technologies. All war suns lose SUSTAIN DAMAGE.
AGAINST : Each player that owns a war sun technology discards all of their action cards.

Agendas.Rearmament Agreement.Description.value: FOR : Each player places 1 mech from their reinforcements on a planet they control in their home system.
AGAINST : Each player replaces each of their mechs with 1 infantry from their reinforcements.

Agendas.Regulated Conscription.Descripti.value: FOR : When a player produces units, they produce only 1 fighter and infantry for its cost instead of 2.

Agendas.Representative Government.Descri.value: FOR : Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the agenda phase. Each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda instead.
AGAINST : At the start of the next strategy phase, each player that voted "Against" exhausts all of their cultural planets.

Agendas.Representative Government.Omega..value: FOR : Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the agenda phase; each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda instead. Players cannot cast additional votes.
AGAINST : At the start of the next strategy phase, each player that voted "Against" exhausts all of their cultural planets.

Agendas.Research Grant Reallocation.Desc.value: The elected player gains any 1 technology of their choice. Then, for each prerequisite on that technology, they remove 1 token from their fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements.

Agendas.Research Team: Biotic.Descriptio.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 green prerequisite.

Agendas.Research Team: Cybernetic.Descri.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 yellow prerequisite.

Agendas.Research Team: Propulsion.Descri.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 blue prerequisite.

Agendas.Research Team: Warfare.Descripti.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 red prerequisite.

Agendas.Search Warrant.Description.value: The elected player gains this card and draws 2 secret objectives.
The owner of this card plays with their secret objectives revealed.

Agendas.Seed of an Empire.Description.value: FOR : The player with most victory points gains 1 victory point.
AGAINST : The player with the fewest victory points gains 1 victory point.

Agendas.Senate Sanctuary.Description.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
The influence value of this planet is increased by 2.

Agendas.Shard of the Throne.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
A player gains this card and 1 victory point when they win a combat against the owner of this card.
Then, the previous owner of this card loses 1 victory point.

Agendas.Shared Research.Description.value: FOR : Each player's units can move through nebulae.
AGAINST : Each player places a command token from their reinforcements in their home system, if able.

Agendas.Swords to Plowshares.Description.value: FOR : Each player destroys half of their infantry on each planet they control, rounded up. Then, each player gains trade goods equal to the number of their infantry that were destroyed.
AGAINST : Each player places 1 infantry from their reinforcements on each planet they control.

Agendas.Terraforming Initiative.Descript.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
The resource and influence values of this planet are increased by 1.

Agendas.The Crown of Emphidia.Descriptio.value: The elected player gains this card.
A player gains this card and 1 victory point after they gain control of a planet in the home system of this card's owner.
Then, the previous owner of this card loses 1 victory point.

Agendas.The Crown of Thalnos.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
During each combat round, the owner of this card may reroll any number of dice; they must destroy each of their units that did not produce a hit with its reroll.

Agendas.Unconventional Measures.Descript.value: FOR : Each player that voted "For" draws 2 action cards.
AGAINST : Each player that voted "For" discards all of their action cards.

Agendas.Wormhole Reconstruction.Descript.value: FOR : All systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole are adjacent to each other.
AGAINST : Each player places a command token from their reinforcements in each system that contains a wormhole and 1 or more of their ships.

Agendas.Wormhole Research.Description.value: FOR : Each player who has 1 or more ships in a system that contains a wormhole may research 1 technology. Then, destroy all ships in systems that contain an alpha or beta wormhole.
AGAINST : Each player that voted "Against" removes 1 command token from their command sheet and returns it to their reinforcements.

Arborec.Abilities.Mitosis.Description.value: Your space docks cannot produce infantry. At the start of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

Arborec.Promissories.Stymie.Description.value: ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Arborec player cannot produce units in or adjacent to non-home systems that contain 1 or more of your units.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Arborec player's units, return this card to the Arborec player.

Arborec.Promissories.Stymie.Omega.Descri.value: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units: You may place 1 command token from that player's reinforcements in any non-home system. Then, return this card to the Arborec player.

Arborec.Units.Duha Menaimon.Description.value: After you activate this system, you may produce up to 5 units in this system.

Arborec.Units.Letani Behemoth.Descriptio.value: DEPLOY: When you would use your MITOSIS faction ability you may replace 1 of your infantry with 1 mech from your reinforcements instead.

Argent Flight.Abilities.Raid Formation.D.value: When 1 or more of your units uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, for each hit produced in excess of your opponent's fighters, choose 1 of your opponent's ships that has SUSTAIN DAMAGE to become damaged.

Argent Flight.Abilities.Zeal.Description.value: You always vote first during the agenda phase. When you cast at least 1 vote, cast 1 additional vote for each player in the game including you.

Argent Flight.Promissories.Strike Wing A.value: When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability:
Choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die
Then, return this card to the Argent player

Argent Flight.Units.Aerie Sentinel.Descr.value: This unit does not count against capacity if it is being transported or if it is in a space area with 1 or more of your ships that have capacity values.

Argent Flight.Units.Quetzecoatl.Descript.value: Other players cannot use SPACE CANNON against your ships in this system.

Barony of Letnev.Abilities.Armada.Descri.value: The maximum number of non-fighter ships you can have in each system is equal to 2 more than the number of tokens in your fleet pool.

Barony of Letnev.Abilities.Munitions Res.value: At the start of each round of space combat, you may spend 2 trade goods; you may re-roll any number of your dice during that combat round.

Barony of Letnev.Promissories.War Fundin.value: At the start of a round of space combat:
The Letnev player loses 2 trade goods.
During this combat round, re-roll any number of your dice.
Then, return this card to the Letnev player.
After you and your opponent roll dice during space combat:
You may reroll all of your opponent's dice. You may reroll any number of your dice.
Then, return this card to the Letnev player.

Barony of Letnev.Units.Arc Secundus.Desc.value: Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD. At the start of each space combat round, repair this ship.

Barony of Letnev.Units.Dunlain Reaper.De.value: DEPLOY: At the start of a round of ground combat, you may spend 2 resources to replace 1 of your infantry in that combat with 1 mech.

Clan of Saar.Abilities.Nomadic.Descripti.value: You can score objectives even if you do not control the planets in your home system.

Clan of Saar.Abilities.Scavenge.Descript.value: After you gain control of a planet, gain 1 trade good.

Clan of Saar.Promissories.Ragh's Call.De.value: After you commit 1 or more units to land on a planet:
Remove all of the Saar player's ground forces from that planet and place them on a planet controlled by the Saar player.
Then return this card to the Saar player.

Clan of Saar.Units.Floating Factory I.De.value: This unit is placed in a space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.

Clan of Saar.Units.Scavenger Zeta.Descri.value: DEPLOY: After you gain control of a planet, you may spend 1 trade good to place 1 mech on that planet.

Council Keleres.Abilities.Council Patron.value: Replenish your commodities at the start of the strategy phase, then gain 1 trade good.

Council Keleres.Abilities.Law's Order.De.value: You may spend 1 influence at the start of your turn to treat all laws as blank until the end of your turn.

Council Keleres.Abilities.The Tribunii.D.value: During setup, choose an unplayed faction from among the Mentak, the Xxcha and the Argent Flight; take that faction's home system, command tokens and control markers. Additionally, take the Keleres Hero that corresponds to that faction.

Council Keleres.Promissories.Keleres Rid.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 1 action card and gain 2 trade goods.
Then, return this card to the Keleres player.

Council Keleres.Units.Artemiris.Descript.value: Other players must spend 2 influence to activate the system that contains this ship.

Council Keleres.Units.Omniopiares.Descri.value: Other players must spend 1 influence to commit ground forces to the planet that contains this unit.

Embers of Muaat.Abilities.Gashlai Physio.value: Your ships can move through supernovas.

Embers of Muaat.Abilities.Star Forge.Des.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your war suns.

Embers of Muaat.Promissories.Fires of th.value: ACTION: Remove 1 token from the Muaat player's fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements. Then, gain your war sun unit upgrade technology card. Then, return this card to the Muaat player.

Embers of Muaat.Units.Ember Colossus.Des.value: When you use your STAR FORGE faction ability in this system or an adjacent system, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements with this unit.

Embers of Muaat.Units.Prototype War Sun.value: Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.

Embers of Muaat.Units.The Inferno.Descri.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 1 cruiser in this unit's system.

Emirates of Hacan.Abilities.Arbiters.Des.value: When you are negotiating a transaction, action cards can be exchanged as part of that transaction.

Emirates of Hacan.Abilities.Guild Ships..value: You can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.

Emirates of Hacan.Abilities.Masters of T.value: You do not have to spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the "Trade" strategy card.

Emirates of Hacan.Promissories.Trade Con.value: ACTION: Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, you may negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Hacan player's units, return this card to the Hacan player.

Emirates of Hacan.Units.Pride of Kenara..value: This planet's card may be traded as part of a transaction; if you do, move all of your units from this planet to another planet you control.

Emirates of Hacan.Units.Wrath of Kenara..value: After you roll a die during a space combat in this system, you may spend 1 trade good to apply +1 to the result.

Empyrean.Abilities.Aetherpassage.Descrip.value: After a player activates a system, you may allow that player to move their ships through systems that contain your ships.

Empyrean.Abilities.Dark Whispers.Descrip.value: During setup, take the additional Empyrean faction promissory note; you have 2 faction promissory notes.

Empyrean.Abilities.Voidborn.Description.value: Nebulae do not affect your ships' movement.

Empyrean.Promissories.Blood Pact.Descrip.value: ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
When you and the Empyrean player cast votes for the same outcome, cast 4 additional votes for that outcome.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Empyrean.Promissories.Dark Pact.Descript.value: ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
When you give a number of commodities to the Empyrean player equal to your maximum commodity value, you each gain 1 trade good.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Empyrean.Units.Dynamo.Description.value: After any player's unit in this system or an adjacent system uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE, you may spend 2 influence to repair that unit.

Empyrean.Units.Watcher.Description.value: You may remove this unit from a system that contains or is adjacent to another player's units to cancel an action card played by that player.

Federation of Sol.Abilities.Orbital Drop.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

Federation of Sol.Abilities.Versatile.De.value: When you gain command tokens during the status phase, gain 1 additional command token.

Federation of Sol.Promissories.Military.value: At the start of the Sol player's turn:
Remove 1 token from the Sol player's strategy pool, if able, and return it to their reinforcements. Then, you may place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.
Then return this card to the Sol player.

Federation of Sol.Units.Genesis.Descript.value: At the end of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements in this system's space area.

Federation of Sol.Units.ZS Thunderbolt M.value: DEPLOY: After you use your ORBITAL DROP faction ability, you may spend 3 resources to place 1 mech on that planet.

Ghosts of Creuss.Abilities.Creuss Gate.D.value: When you create the game board, place the Creuss Gate (tile 17) where your home system would normally be placed. The Creuss Gate system is not a home system. Then, place your home system (tile 51) in your play area.

Ghosts of Creuss.Abilities.Quantum Entan.value: You treat all systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole as adjacent to each other. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

Ghosts of Creuss.Abilities.Slipstream.De.value: During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains either an alpha or beta wormhole.

Ghosts of Creuss.Promissories.Creuss Iff.value: At the start of your turn during the action phase:
Place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.
Then, return this card to the Creuss player.

Ghosts of Creuss.Units.Hil Colish.Descri.value: This ship's system contains a delta wormhole. During movement, this ship may move before or after your other ships.

Ghosts of Creuss.Units.Icarus Drive.Desc.value: After any player activates a system, you may remove this unit from the game board to place or move a Creuss wormhole token into this system.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Abilities.Assimilate.Descr.value: When you gain control of a planet, replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Abilities.Harrow.Descripti.value: At the end of each round of ground combat, your ships in the active system may use their BOMBARDMENT abilities against your opponent's ground forces on the planet.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Promissories.Cybernetic En.value: At the start of your turn:
Remove 1 token from the L1Z1X player's strategy pool and return it to their reinforcements. Then, place 1 command token from your reinforcements in your strategy pool.
Then, return this card to the L1Z1X player.
When you gain command tokens during the status phase:
Then, return this card to the L1Z1X player.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Units.Annihilator.Descript.value: While not participating in ground combat, this unit can use its BOMBARDMENT ability on planets in its system as if it were a ship.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Units.[0.0.1].Description.value: During a space combat, hits produced by this ship and by your dreadnoughts in this system must be assigned to non-fighter ships if able.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Abilities.Edict.De.value: When you win a combat, place 1 command token from your opponent's reinforcements in your fleet pool if it does not already contain 1 of that player's tokens; other player's tokens in your fleet pool increase your fleet limit but cannot be redistributed.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Abilities.Hubris.D.value: During setup, purge your "Alliance" promissory note. Other players cannot give you their "Alliance" promissory note.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Abilities.Imperia..value: While another player's command token is in your fleet pool, you can use the ability of that player's commander, if it is unlocked.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Promissories.Scept.value: At the start of the strategy phase:
Choose 1 non-home system that contains your units; each other player who has a token on the Mahact player's command sheet places a token from their reinforcements in that system
Then, return this card to the Mahact player.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Units.Arvicon Rex..value: During combat against an opponent whose command token is not in your fleet pool, apply +2 to the results of this unit's combat rolls.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Units.Crimson Legi.value: After this unit is destroyed, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Units.Starlancer.D.value: After a player whose command token is in your fleet pool activates this system, you may spend their token from your fleet pool to end their turn; they gain that token.

Mentak Coalition.Abilities.Ambush.Descri.value: At the start of a space combat, you may roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your cruisers or destroyers in the system. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, produce 1 hit; your opponent must assign it to 1 of their ships.

Mentak Coalition.Abilities.Pillage.Descr.value: After 1 of your neighbors gains trade goods or resolves a transaction, if they have 3 or more trade goods, you may take 1 of their trade goods or commodities.

Mentak Coalition.Promissories.Promise of.value: ACTION: Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Mentak player cannot use their PILLAGE faction ability against you.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Mentak player's units, return this card to the Mentak player.

Mentak Coalition.Units.Fourth Moon.Descr.value: Other players' ships in this system cannot use SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

Mentak Coalition.Units.Moll Terminus.Des.value: Other players' ground forces on this planet cannot use SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

Naalu Collective.Abilities.Foresight.Des.value: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, you may place 1 token from your strategy pool in an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; move your ships from the active system into that system.

Naalu Collective.Abilities.Telepathic.De.value: At the end of the strategy phase, place the Naalu "0" token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order.

Naalu Collective.Promissories.Gift of Pr.value: At the end of the strategy phase:

Place this card face-up in your play area and place the Naalu "0" token on your strategy card; you are first in the initiative order. The Naalu player cannot use their TELEPATHIC faction ability during this game round.
Return this card to the Naalu player at the end of the status phase.

Naalu Collective.Units.Iconoclast.Descri.value: During combat against an opponent who has at least 1 relic fragment, apply +2 to the results of this unit's combat rolls.

Naalu Collective.Units.Iconoclast.Omega..value: Other players cannot use ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE against your units in this system.

Naalu Collective.Units.Matriarch.Descrip.value: During an invasion in this system, you may commit fighters to planets as if they were ground forces. When combat ends, return those units to the space area.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Abilities.Distant Su.value: When you explore a planet that contains 1 of your mechs, you may draw 1 additional card; choose 1 to resolve and discard the rest.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Abilities.Fabricatio.value: ACTION: Either purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic; or purge 1 of your relic fragments to gain 1 command token.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Promissories.Black M.value: ACTION: Purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic.
Then return this card to the Naaz-Rokha player.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Units.Eidolon.Descri.value: If this unit is in the space area of the active system at the start of a space combat, flip this card.
(This card begins the game with this side face up)

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Units.Visz el Vir.De.value: Your mechs in this system roll 1 additional die during combat.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Units.Z-Grav Eidolon.value: If this unit is in the space area of the active system, it is also a ship. At the end of a space battle in the active system, flip this card.
(This card begins the game with this side face down)

Nekro Virus.Abilities.Galactic Threat.De.value: You cannot vote on agendas. Once per agenda phase, after an agenda is revealed, you may predict aloud the outcome of that agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 technology that is owned by a player who voted how you predicted.

Nekro Virus.Abilities.Propagation.Descri.value: You cannot research technology. When you would research a technology, gain 3 command tokens instead.

Nekro Virus.Abilities.Technological Sing.value: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed, you may gain 1 technology that is owned by that player.

Nekro Virus.Promissories.Antivirus.Descr.value: At the start of a combat:
Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Nekro player cannot use their TECHNOLOGICAL SINGULARITY faction ability against you.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Nekro player's units, return this card to the Nekro player.

Nekro Virus.Units.Mordred.Description.value: During combat against an opponent who has an "X" or "Y" token on 1 or more of their technologies, apply +2 to the result of each of this unit's combat rolls.

Nekro Virus.Units.The Alastor.Descriptio.value: At the start of a space combat, choose any number of your ground forces in this system to participate in that combat as if they were ships.

Nomad.Abilities.Future Sight.Description.value: During the Agenda phase, after an outcome that you voted for or predicted is resolved, gain 1 trade good.

Nomad.Abilities.The Company.Description.value: During setup, take the 2 additional Nomad faction agents and place them next to your faction sheet; you have 3 agents.

Nomad.Promissories.The Cavalry.Descripti.value: At the start of a space combat against a player other than the Nomad:
During this combat, treat 1 of your non-fighter ships as if it has the SUSTAIN DAMAGE ability, combat value, and ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE value of the Nomad's flagship.
Return this card to the Nomad player at the end of this combat.

Nomad.Units.Memoria.Description.value: You may treat this unit as if it were adjacent to systems that contain one or more of your mechs.

Nomad.Units.Quantum Manipulator.Descript.value: While this unit is in a space area during combat, you may use its SUSTAIN DAMAGE ability to cancel a hit that is produced against your ships in this system.

Sardakk N'orr.Abilities.Unrelenting.Desc.value: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.

Sardakk N'orr.Promissories.Tekklar Legio.value: At the start of an invasion combat:
Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat. If your opponent is the N'orr player, apply -1 to the result of each of their unit's combat rolls during this combat.
Then, return this card to the N'orr player.

Sardakk N'orr.Units.C'Morran N'orr.Descr.value: Apply +1 to the result of each of your other ship's combat rolls in this system.

Sardakk N'orr.Units.Valkyrie Exoskeleton.value: After this unit uses its SUSTAIN DAMAGE ability during ground combat, it produces 1 hit against your opponent's ground forces on this planet.

Titans of Ul.Abilities.Awaken.Descriptio.value: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your sleeper tokens, you may replace each of those tokens with 1 PDS from your reinforcements.

Titans of Ul.Abilities.Coalescence.Descr.value: If your flagship or your AWAKEN faction ability places your units into the same space area or onto the same planet as another player's units, your units must participate in combat during "Space Combat" or "Ground Combat" steps.

Titans of Ul.Abilities.Terragenesis.Desc.value: After you explore a planet that does not have a sleeper token, you may place or move 1 sleeper token onto that planet.

Titans of Ul.Promissories.Terraform.Desc.value: ACTION: Attach this card to a non-home planet you control other than Mecatol Rex.
Its resource and influence values are each increased by 1 and it is treated as having all 3 planet traits (Cultural, Hazardous, and Industrial).

Titans of Ul.Units.Hecatoncheires.Descri.value: DEPLOY: When you would place a PDS on a planet, you may place 1 mech and 1 infantry on that planet instead.

Titans of Ul.Units.Hel Titan I.Descripti.value: This unit is treated as both a structure and a ground force. It cannot be transported.

Titans of Ul.Units.Ouranos.Description.value: DEPLOY: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your PDS, you may replace 1 of those PDS with this unit.

Universities of Jol-Nar.Abilities.Analyt.value: When you research a technology that is not a unit upgrade technology, you may ignore 1 prerequisite.

Universities of Jol-Nar.Abilities.Brilli.value: When you spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the "Technology" strategy card, you may resolve the primary ability instead.

Universities of Jol-Nar.Abilities.Fragil.value: Apply -1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.

Universities of Jol-Nar.Promissories.Res.value: After the Jol-Nar player researches a technology that is not a faction technology:
Then, return this card to the Jol-Nar player.

Universities of Jol-Nar.Units.J.N.S. Hyl.value: When making a combat roll for this ship, each result of 9 or 10, before applying modifiers, produces 2 additional hits.

Universities of Jol-Nar.Units.Shield Pal.value: Your infantry on this planet are not affected by your FRAGILE faction ability.

Vuil'raith Cabal.Abilities.Amalgamation..value: When you produce a unit, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to produce that unit without spending resources.

Vuil'raith Cabal.Abilities.Devour.Descri.value: Capture your opponent's non-structure units that are destroyed during combat.

Vuil'raith Cabal.Abilities.Riftmeld.Desc.value: When you research a unit upgrade technology, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to ignore all of the technology's prerequisites.

Vuil'raith Cabal.Promissories.Crucible.D.value: Your ships do not roll for gravity rifts during this movement; apply an additional +1 to the move values of your ships that would move out of or through a gravity rift instead.
Then, return this card to the Vuil'raith player.

Vuil'raith Cabal.Units.Dimensional Tear.value: This system is a gravity rift; your ships do not roll for this gravity rift.
Place a dimensional tear token beneath this unit as a reminder.
Up to 6 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.

Vuil'raith Cabal.Units.Reanimator.Descri.value: When your infantry on this planet are destroyed, place them on your faction sheet; those units are captured.

Vuil'raith Cabal.Units.The Terror Betwee.value: Capture all other non-structure units that are destroyed in this system, including your own.

Winnu.Abilities.Blood Ties.Description.value: You do not have to spend influence to remove the custodians token from Mecatol Rex.

Winnu.Abilities.Reclamation.Description.value: After you resolve a tactical action during which you gained control of Mecatol Rex, you may place 1 PDS and 1 space dock from your reinforcements on Mecatol Rex.

Winnu.Promissories.Acquiescence.Descript.value: At the end of the strategy phase:
Exchange 1 of your strategy cards with a strategy card that was chosen by the Winnu player.
Then, return this card to the Winnu player.

Winnu.Promissories.Acquiescence.Omega.De.value: When the Winnu player resolves a strategic action:
You do not have to spend or place a command token to resolve the secondary ability of that strategy card.
Then, return this card to the Winnu player.

Winnu.Units.Reclaimer.Description.value: After you resolve a tactical action where you gained control of this planet, you may place 1 PDS or 1 Space Dock from your reinforcements on this planet.

Winnu.Units.Salai Sai Corian.Description.value: When this unit makes a combat roll, it rolls a number of dice equal to the number of your opponent's non-fighter ships in this system.

Xxcha Kingdom.Abilities.Peace Accords.De.value: After you resolve the primary or secondary ability of the "Diplomacy" strategy card, you may gain control of 1 planet other than Mecatol Rex that does not contain any units and is in a system that is adjacent to a planet you control.

Xxcha Kingdom.Abilities.Quash.Descriptio.value: When an agenda is revealed, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool to discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.

Xxcha Kingdom.Promissories.Political Fav.value: Remove 1 token from the Xxcha player's strategy pool and return it to their reinforcements. Then, discard the revealed agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.
Then, return this card to the Xxcha player.

Xxcha Kingdom.Units.Indomitus.Descriptio.value: You may use this unit's SPACE CANNON ability against ships that are in adjacent systems.

Xxcha Kingdom.Units.Loncara Ssodu.Descri.value: You may use this unit's SPACE CANNON against ships that are in adjacent systems.

Yin Brotherhood.Abilities.Devotion.Descr.value: After each space battle round, you may destroy 1 of your cruisers or destroyers in the active system to produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships in that system.

Yin Brotherhood.Abilities.Indoctrination.value: At the start of a ground combat, you may spend 2 influence to replace 1 of your opponent's participating infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.

Yin Brotherhood.Promissories.Greyfire Mu.value: The Yin player cannot use faction abilities or faction technology during this tactical action.
Then, return this card to the Yin player.
At the start of a ground combat against 2 or more ground forces that are not controlled by the Yin player:
Replace 1 of your opponent's infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.
Then, return this card to the Yin player.

Yin Brotherhood.Units.Moyin's Ashes.Desc.value: DEPLOY: When you use your INDOCTRINATION faction ability, you may spend 1 additional influence to replace your opponent's unit with 1 mech instead of 1 infantry.

Yin Brotherhood.Units.Van Hauge.Descript.value: When this ship is destroyed, destroy all ships in this system.

Yssaril Tribes.Abilities.Crafty.Descript.value: You can have any number of action cards in your hand. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

Yssaril Tribes.Abilities.Scheming.Descri.value: When you draw 1 or more action cards, draw 1 additional action card. Then, choose and discard 1 action card from your hand.

Yssaril Tribes.Abilities.Stall Tactics.D.value: ACTION: Discard 1 action card from your hand.

Yssaril Tribes.Promissories.Spy Net.Desc.value: At the start of your turn:
Look at the Yssaril player's hand of action cards. Choose 1 of those cards and add it to your hand.
Then, return this card to the Yssaril player.

Yssaril Tribes.Units.Blackshade Infiltra.value: DEPLOY: After you use your STALL TACTICS faction ability, you may place 1 mech on a planet you control.

Yssaril Tribes.Units.Y'sia Y'ssrila.Desc.value: This ship can move through systems that contain other player's ships.
